tool.name: extract_biotics

param.name: BioticsPF
param.dialogReference: The SQL query layer displaying Procedural Features stored in Biotics.

param.name: BioticsCS
param.dialogReference: The SQL query layer displaying Conservation Sites stored in Biotics.

param.name: outGDB
param.dialogReference: The geodatabase in which the copied features will be stored. This should preferably be a geodatabase stored on your local hard drive.

tool.summary:
Extracts Procedural Features and Conservation Sites from Biotics SQL query layers and copies them to a specified geodatabase.

IMPORTANT: This tool must be run from within an ArcMap document containing SQL query layers displaying Procedural Features and Conservation Sites.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Extracts Procedural Features and Conservation Sites from Biotics SQL query layers and copies them to a specified geodatabase.

IMPORTANT: This tool must be run from within an ArcMap document containing SQL query layers displaying Procedural Features and Conservation Sites.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Kirsten R. Hazler (Virginia Natural Heritage Program)
